snippet: Video-game retail sales are faltering. Will Nintendo’s coming Wii U prove the industry’s salvation?
abstract: Nintendo hopes its new gaming system, the Wii U, will revive the video game industry as a weak economy and the rising popularity of smartphone apps leads retail sales to decline; Chris Suellentrop of Yahoo News and Stephen Totilo of gaming site Kotaku.com discuss the challenges facing the changing industry today.

byline.original: By CHRIS SUELLENTROP and STEPHEN TOTILO

lead_paragraph: Video-game retail sales are faltering. Will Nintendo’s coming Wii U prove the industry’s salvation?

headline.seo: Video Game Retail Sales Decline Despite New Hits
headline.main: Gaming Faces Its Archenemy: Financial Reality
headline.print_headline: Gaming Faces Its Archenemy: Financial Reality
